meanings.definition: To publish simultaneously in multiple newspapers or broadcast on multiple radio or television stations.
meanings.sent1: The news article was syndicated to various newspapers across the country.
meanings.sent2: The radio show was syndicated on different stations at the same time.
meanings.sent3: The syndicated comic strip brought smiles to readers everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were syndicated like wildfire, spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The syndicated content reached a wide audience, making it popular.

meanings.definition: Distributed or sold for simultaneous publication or broadcast in multiple outlets.
meanings.sent1: The syndicated column appeared in many newspapers at once.
meanings.sent2: The syndicated TV series was watched by viewers nationwide.
meanings.sent3: The syndicated merchandise flew off the shelves in stores.
meanings.sent4: Her syndicated artwork adorned walls in homes everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The syndicated products were in high demand due to their wide availability.
